lines.content: Welcome to **Amadeus**, your friendly command-line task manager chatbot!
Amadeus helps you manage your todos, deadlines, and events, all through a simple text interface.
It also has fun modes like Echo and D-mail to experiment with messages.
2. Amadeus will greet you and show the available modes:
3. Type the name of the mode you want to use and press Enter.
Echo mode repeats whatever you type until you type `Esc`.
D-mail mode sends messages to the past (in the program's story!). Exit with `El Psy Kongroo`.
(It is the same as the echo mode with some personalisation)
📧 Message received in world line 1.130205%: Hello past!
List mode lets you manage your tasks: add, mark, unmark, delete, and find.
Add a simple task to your list.
Add a task with a due date.
Add a task with a start and end time.
Mark a task as not done.
Remove a task from your list.
Search for tasks containing a specific word.
Say goodbye to Amadeus and close the program.
System shutting down... awaiting next transmission.
- Dates and times must be entered in the format `yyyy-MM-dd HHmm`.
- Task numbers refer to the number shown in the `list` command.
- Your tasks are automatically saved between sessions in the file path given at startup (default: `./data/amadeus.txt`).
- Always type commands exactly as shown (case-insensitive for commands like `mark`, `unmark`, `todo`, etc.).
- Modes Echo and D-mail are fun experimentation modes but you can always return to List mode to manage tasks.
Enjoy using **Amadeus** to organize your tasks and explore time-message fun!

public Deadline(String description, String byStr) throws AmadeusException {

* Get the deadline date and time.
* Task for event. It has start and optional end date-time.
* Create event with description, start and end string.
* @param fromStr start date-time like yyyy-MM-dd HHmm
* @param toStr end date-time like yyyy-MM-dd HHmm or empty
* @throws AmadeusException if date format is wrong
public Event(String description, String fromStr, String toStr) throws AmadeusException {
throw new AmadeusException("Invalid start date format. Please use yyyy-MM-dd HHmm.");
throw new AmadeusException("Invalid end date format. Please use yyyy-MM-dd HHmm.");
String toStr = to != null ? " to " + to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HH:mm")) : "";
/** Get end date-time of event, may be null */
* This class handle parsing of commands from user.
* It decide what mode to run based on input command.
* Parse user command and run proper mode.
* If command unknown it throws exception.
* @param scanner scanner to read user input in modes
* @param taskList list of tasks to operate on
* @param storage storage object to save/load tasks
* @param ui user interface to show messages
* @throws IOException if saving or loading tasks fails
public static void parse(String command, Scanner scanner, TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui)
case Commands.LIST -> runListMode(scanner, taskList, storage, ui);
default -> throw new AmadeusException("⚠️ Unknown command. Try again.");
* Runs echo mode, it just repeat what user type.
* User can type 'Esc' to exit this mode.
* @param ui user interface to show messages
private static void runEchoMode(Scanner scanner, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("The Mad Scientist chose the option Echo");
System.out.println("Echo mode activated. Type 'Esc' to exit.");
* Runs D-mail mode, user can send message to past.
* Type 'El Psy Kongroo' to exit mode safely.
* @param ui user interface to show messages
private static void runDmailMode(Scanner scanner, Ui ui) {
System.out.println("The Mad Scientist chose to send a D-mail");
System.out.println("D-mail mode activated. Type 'El Psy Kongroo' to exit.");
System.out.println("The SERN is spying us, we need to disconnect...");
System.out.println("⚠️ Your position has been compromised. Flee immediately.");
System.out.println("📱 D-mail is sending to the past...");
System.out.println("📧 Message received in world line 1.130205%: " + input);
* Runs list mode, it allow to manage tasks.
* User can type 'Bye' to exit list mode.
* @throws AmadeusException if command in list mode is unknown
private static void runListMode(Scanner scanner, TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui)
System.out.println("List mode activated. Type 'Bye' to exit.");
* Runs find mode, allow user to search keyword in tasks.

private static void runFindMode(Scanner scanner, TaskList taskList) {
System.out.println("Find mode activated. Type a keyword to search in tasks:");

* This class manage the list of tasks.
* It allow to add, remove, mark, unmark and find tasks.
* It also handle commands from user in list mode.
* Creates TaskList with already existing tasks.
* @param tasks list of tasks to initialize with
* Handle command from user and execute it.
* Command can be list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event, delete or find.
* @param storage storage to save tasks, can be null for find
* @param ui user interface to show messages, can be null for find
* @throws AmadeusException if command unknown or invalid
public void handleCommand(String input, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws IOException, AmadeusException {

throw new AmadeusException("Usage: deadline <desc> /by yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");

throw new AmadeusException("Please provide a keyword to search for.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

public static void taskUpdated(String msg, Task task) {

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Show that a task is deleted from list.
